60#define DEFAULT_COPY_BUFLEN 32768 /* Size of buffer for up/download */
61#define DEFAULT_NUM_REQUESTS 256 /* # concurrent outstanding requests */
62
63/* File to read commands from */
64FILE* infile;
65
66/* Are we in batchfile mode? */
67int batchmode = 0;
68
69/* PID of ssh transport process */
70static volatile pid_t sshpid = -1;
71
72/* Suppress diagnositic messages */
73int quiet = 0;
74
75/* This is set to 0 if the progressmeter is not desired. */
76int showprogress = 1;
77
78/* When this option is set, we always recursively download/upload directories */
79int global_rflag = 0;
80
81/* When this option is set, we resume download or upload if possible */
82int global_aflag = 0;
83
84/* When this option is set, the file transfers will always preserve times */
85int global_pflag = 0;
86
87/* When this option is set, transfers will have fsync() called on each file */
88int global_fflag = 0;
89
90/* SIGINT received during command processing */
91volatile sig_atomic_t interrupted = 0;
92
93/* I wish qsort() took a separate ctx for the comparison function...*/
94int sort_flag;
95glob_t *sort_glob;

97/* Context used for commandline completion */
98struct complete_ctx {
99 struct sftp_conn *conn;
100 char **remote_pathp;
101};

103int remote_glob(struct sftp_conn *, const char *, int,
104 int (*)(const char *, int), glob_t *); /* proto for sftp-glob.c */
105
106/* Separators for interactive commands */
107#define WHITESPACE " \t\r\n"
108
109/* ls flags */
110#define LS_LONG_VIEW 0x0001 /* Full view ala ls -l */
111#define LS_SHORT_VIEW 0x0002 /* Single row view ala ls -1 */
112#define LS_NUMERIC_VIEW 0x0004 /* Long view with numeric uid/gid */
113#define LS_NAME_SORT 0x0008 /* Sort by name (default) */
114#define LS_TIME_SORT 0x0010 /* Sort by mtime */
115#define LS_SIZE_SORT 0x0020 /* Sort by file size */
116#define LS_REVERSE_SORT 0x0040 /* Reverse sort order */
117#define LS_SHOW_ALL 0x0080 /* Don't skip filenames starting with '.' */
118#define LS_SI_UNITS 0x0100 /* Display sizes as K, M, G, etc. */
119
120#define VIEW_FLAGS (LS_LONG_VIEW|LS_SHORT_VIEW|LS_NUMERIC_VIEW|LS_SI_UNITS)
121#define SORT_FLAGS (LS_NAME_SORT|LS_TIME_SORT|LS_SIZE_SORT)
122
123/* Commands for interactive mode */
124enum sftp_command {
125 I_CHDIR = 1,
126 I_CHGRP,
127 I_CHMOD,
128 I_CHOWN,
129 I_DF,
130 I_GET,
131 I_HELP,
132 I_LCHDIR,
133 I_LINK,
134 I_LLS,
135 I_LMKDIR,
136 I_LPWD,
137 I_LS,
138 I_LUMASK,
139 I_MKDIR,
140 I_PUT,
141 I_PWD,
142 I_QUIT,
143 I_REGET,
144 I_RENAME,
145 I_REPUT,
146 I_RM,
147 I_RMDIR,
148 I_SHELL,
149 I_SYMLINK,
150 I_VERSION,
151 I_PROGRESS,
152};
153
154struct CMD {
155 const char *c;
156 const int n;
157 const int t;
158};
159
160/* Type of completion */
161#define NOARGS 0
162#define REMOTE 1
163#define LOCAL 2
164

200 { "?", I_HELP, NOARGS },
201 { NULL, -1, -1 }

203
204/* ARGSUSED */
205__dead static void
206killchild(int signo)
207{
208 if (sshpid > 1) {
209 kill(sshpid, SIGTERM);
210 waitpid(sshpid, NULL, 0);
211 }
212
213 _exit(1);
214}
215
216/* ARGSUSED */
217static void
218suspchild(int signo)
219{
220 if (sshpid > 1) {
221 kill(sshpid, signo);
222 while (waitpid(sshpid, NULL, WUNTRACED) == -1 && errno == EINTR)
223 continue;
224 }
225 kill(getpid(), SIGSTOP);
226}
227
228/* ARGSUSED */
229static void
230cmd_interrupt(int signo)
231{
232 const char msg[] = "\rInterrupt \n";
233 int olderrno = errno;
234
235 (void)write(STDERR_FILENO, msg, sizeof(msg) - 1);
236 interrupted = 1;
237 errno = olderrno;
238}
239
240/*ARGSUSED*/
241static void
242sigchld_handler(int sig)
243{
244 int save_errno = errno;
245 pid_t pid;
246 const char msg[] = "\rConnection closed. \n";
247
248 /* Report if ssh transport process dies. */
249 while ((pid = waitpid(sshpid, NULL, WNOHANG)) == -1 && errno == EINTR)
250 continue;
251 if (pid == sshpid) {
252 (void)write(STDERR_FILENO, msg, sizeof(msg) - 1);
253 sshpid = -1;
254 }
255
256 errno = save_errno;
257}
258
259static void
260help(void)
261{
262 printf("Available commands:\n"
263 "bye Quit sftp\n"
264 "cd path Change remote directory to 'path'\n"
265 "chgrp [-h] grp path Change group of file 'path' to 'grp'\n"
266 "chmod [-h] mode path Change permissions of file 'path' to 'mode'\n"
267 "chown [-h] own path Change owner of file 'path' to 'own'\n"
268 "df [-hi] [path] Display statistics for current directory or\n"
269 " filesystem containing 'path'\n"
270 "exit Quit sftp\n"
271 "get [-afPpRr] remote [local] Download file\n"
272 "reget [-fPpRr] remote [local] Resume download file\n"
273 "reput [-fPpRr] [local] remote Resume upload file\n"
274 "help Display this help text\n"
275 "lcd path Change local directory to 'path'\n"
276 "lls [ls-options [path]] Display local directory listing\n"
277 "lmkdir path Create local directory\n"
278 "ln [-s] oldpath newpath Link remote file (-s for symlink)\n"
279 "lpwd Print local working directory\n"
280 "ls [-1afhlnrSt] [path] Display remote directory listing\n"
281 "lumask umask Set local umask to 'umask'\n"
282 "mkdir path Create remote directory\n"
283 "progress Toggle display of progress meter\n"
284 "put [-afPpRr] local [remote] Upload file\n"
285 "pwd Display remote working directory\n"
286 "quit Quit sftp\n"
287 "rename oldpath newpath Rename remote file\n"
288 "rm path Delete remote file\n"
289 "rmdir path Remove remote directory\n"
290 "symlink oldpath newpath Symlink remote file\n"
291 "version Show SFTP version\n"
292 "!command Execute 'command' in local shell\n"
293 "! Escape to local shell\n"
294 "? Synonym for help\n");
295}
296
297static void
298local_do_shell(const char *args)
299{
300 int status;
301 const char *shell;
302 pid_t pid;
303
304 if (!*args)
305 args = NULL;
306
307 if ((shell = getenv("SHELL")) == NULL || *shell == '\0')
308 shell = _PATH_BSHELL;
309
310 if ((pid = fork()) == -1)
311 fatal("Couldn't fork: %s", strerror(errno));
312
313 if (pid == 0) {
314 /* XXX: child has pipe fds to ssh subproc open - issue? */
315 if (args) {
316 debug3("Executing %s -c \"%s\"", shell, args);
317 execl(shell, shell, "-c", args, (char *)NULL);
318 } else {
319 debug3("Executing %s", shell);
320 execl(shell, shell, (char *)NULL);
321 }
322 fprintf(stderr, "Couldn't execute \"%s\": %s\n", shell,
323 strerror(errno));
324 _exit(1);
325 }
326 while (waitpid(pid, &status, 0) == -1)
327 if (errno != EINTR)
328 fatal("Couldn't wait for child: %s", strerror(errno));
329 if (!WIFEXITED(status))
330 error("Shell exited abnormally");
331 else if (WEXITSTATUS(status))
332 error("Shell exited with status %d", WEXITSTATUS(status));
333}
334
335static void
336local_do_ls(const char *args)
337{
338 if (!args || !*args)
339 local_do_shell(_PATH_LS);
340 else {
341 int len = strlen(_PATH_LS " ") + strlen(args) + 1;
342 char *buf = xmalloc(len);
343
344 /* XXX: quoting - rip quoting code from ftp? */
345 snprintf(buf, len, _PATH_LS " %s", args);
346 local_do_shell(buf);
347 free(buf);
348 }
349}
350
351/* Strip one path (usually the pwd) from the start of another */
352static char *
353path_strip(const char *path, const char *strip)
354{
355 size_t len;
356
357 if (strip == NULL)
358 return (xstrdup(path));
359
360 len = strlen(strip);
361 if (strncmp(path, strip, len) == 0) {
362 if (strip[len - 1] != '/' && path[len] == '/')
363 len++;
364 return (xstrdup(path + len));
365 }
366
367 return (xstrdup(path));
368}
369
370static char *
371make_absolute(char *p, const char *pwd)
372{
373 char *abs_str;
374
375 /* Derelativise */
376 if (p && !path_absolute(p)) {
377 abs_str = path_append(pwd, p);
378 free(p);
379 return(abs_str);
380 } else
381 return(p);
382}
383
384static int
385parse_getput_flags(const char *cmd, char **argv, int argc,
386 int *aflag, int *fflag, int *pflag, int *rflag)
387{
388 extern int opterr, optind, optopt, optreset;
389 int ch;
390
391 optind = optreset = 1;
392 opterr = 0;
393
394 *aflag = *fflag = *rflag = *pflag = 0;
395 while ((ch = getopt(argc, argv, "afPpRr")) != -1) {
396 switch (ch) {
397 case 'a':
398 *aflag = 1;
399 break;
400 case 'f':
401 *fflag = 1;
402 break;
403 case 'p':
404 case 'P':
405 *pflag = 1;
406 break;
407 case 'r':
408 case 'R':
409 *rflag = 1;
410 break;
411 default:
412 error("%s: Invalid flag -%c", cmd, optopt);
413 return -1;
414 }
415 }
416
417 return optind;
418}
419
420static int
421parse_link_flags(const char *cmd, char **argv, int argc, int *sflag)
422{
423 extern int opterr, optind, optopt, optreset;
424 int ch;
425
426 optind = optreset = 1;
427 opterr = 0;
428
429 *sflag = 0;
430 while ((ch = getopt(argc, argv, "s")) != -1) {
431 switch (ch) {
432 case 's':
433 *sflag = 1;
434 break;
435 default:
436 error("%s: Invalid flag -%c", cmd, optopt);
437 return -1;
438 }
439 }
440
441 return optind;
442}
443
444static int
445parse_rename_flags(const char *cmd, char **argv, int argc, int *lflag)
446{
447 extern int opterr, optind, optopt, optreset;
448 int ch;
449
450 optind = optreset = 1;
451 opterr = 0;
452
453 *lflag = 0;
454 while ((ch = getopt(argc, argv, "l")) != -1) {
455 switch (ch) {
456 case 'l':
457 *lflag = 1;
458 break;
459 default:
460 error("%s: Invalid flag -%c", cmd, optopt);
461 return -1;
462 }
463 }
464
465 return optind;
466}
467
468static int
469parse_ls_flags(char **argv, int argc, int *lflag)
470{
471 extern int opterr, optind, optopt, optreset;
472 int ch;
473
474 optind = optreset = 1;
475 opterr = 0;
476
477 *lflag = LS_NAME_SORT;
478 while ((ch = getopt(argc, argv, "1Safhlnrt")) != -1) {
479 switch (ch) {
480 case '1':
481 *lflag &= ~VIEW_FLAGS;
482 *lflag |= LS_SHORT_VIEW;
483 break;
484 case 'S':
485 *lflag &= ~SORT_FLAGS;
486 *lflag |= LS_SIZE_SORT;
487 break;
488 case 'a':
489 *lflag |= LS_SHOW_ALL;
490 break;
491 case 'f':
492 *lflag &= ~SORT_FLAGS;
493 break;
494 case 'h':
495 *lflag |= LS_SI_UNITS;
496 break;
497 case 'l':
498 *lflag &= ~LS_SHORT_VIEW;
499 *lflag |= LS_LONG_VIEW;
500 break;
501 case 'n':
502 *lflag &= ~LS_SHORT_VIEW;
503 *lflag |= LS_NUMERIC_VIEW|LS_LONG_VIEW;
504 break;
505 case 'r':
506 *lflag |= LS_REVERSE_SORT;
507 break;
508 case 't':
509 *lflag &= ~SORT_FLAGS;
510 *lflag |= LS_TIME_SORT;
511 break;
512 default:
513 error("ls: Invalid flag -%c", optopt);
514 return -1;
515 }
516 }
517
518 return optind;
519}
520
521static int
522parse_df_flags(const char *cmd, char **argv, int argc, int *hflag, int *iflag)
523{
524 extern int opterr, optind, optopt, optreset;
525 int ch;
526
527 optind = optreset = 1;
528 opterr = 0;
529
530 *hflag = *iflag = 0;
531 while ((ch = getopt(argc, argv, "hi")) != -1) {
532 switch (ch) {
533 case 'h':
534 *hflag = 1;
535 break;
536 case 'i':
537 *iflag = 1;
538 break;
539 default:
540 error("%s: Invalid flag -%c", cmd, optopt);
541 return -1;
542 }
543 }
544
545 return optind;
546}

548static int
549parse_ch_flags(const char *cmd, char **argv, int argc, int *hflag)
550{
551 extern int opterr, optind, optopt, optreset;
552 int ch;
553
554 optind = optreset = 1;
555 opterr = 0;
556
557 *hflag = 0;
558 while ((ch = getopt(argc, argv, "h")) != -1) {
559 switch (ch) {
560 case 'h':
561 *hflag = 1;
562 break;
563 default:
564 error("%s: Invalid flag -%c", cmd, optopt);
565 return -1;
566 }
567 }
568
569 return optind;
570}
571
572static int
573parse_no_flags(const char *cmd, char **argv, int argc)
574{
575 extern int opterr, optind, optopt, optreset;
576 int ch;
577
578 optind = optreset = 1;
579 opterr = 0;
580
581 while ((ch = getopt(argc, argv, "")) != -1) {
582 switch (ch) {
583 default:
584 error("%s: Invalid flag -%c", cmd, optopt);
585 return -1;
586 }
587 }
588
589 return optind;
590}
591
592static int
593is_dir(const char *path)
594{
595 struct stat sb;
596
597 /* XXX: report errors? */
598 if (stat(path, &sb) == -1)
599 return(0);
600
601 return(S_ISDIR(sb.st_mode));
602}
603
604static int
605remote_is_dir(struct sftp_conn *conn, const char *path)
606{
607 Attrib *a;
608
609 /* XXX: report errors? */
610 if ((a = do_stat(conn, path, 1)) == NULL)
611 return(0);
612 if (!(a->flags & SSH2_FILEXFER_ATTR_PERMISSIONS))
613 return(0);
614 return(S_ISDIR(a->perm));
615}
616
617/* Check whether path returned from glob(..., GLOB_MARK, ...) is a directory */
618static int
619pathname_is_dir(const char *pathname)
620{
621 size_t l = strlen(pathname);
622
623 return l > 0 && pathname[l - 1] == '/';
624}
625
626static int
627process_get(struct sftp_conn *conn, const char *src, const char *dst,
628 const char *pwd, int pflag, int rflag, int resume, int fflag)
629{
630 char *abs_src = NULL;
631 char *abs_dst = NULL;
632 glob_t g;
633 char *filename, *tmp=NULL;
634 int i, r, err = 0;
635
636 abs_src = xstrdup(src);
637 abs_src = make_absolute(abs_src, pwd);
638 memset(&g, 0, sizeof(g));
639
640 debug3("Looking up %s", abs_src);
641 if ((r = remote_glob(conn, abs_src, GLOB_MARK, NULL, &g)) != 0) {
642 if (r == GLOB_NOSPACE) {
643 error("Too many matches for \"%s\".", abs_src);
644 } else {
645 error("File \"%s\" not found.", abs_src);
646 }
647 err = -1;
648 goto out;
649 }
650
651 /*
652 * If multiple matches then dst must be a directory or
653 * unspecified.
654 */
655 if (g.gl_matchc > 1 && dst != NULL && !is_dir(dst)) {
656 error("Multiple source paths, but destination "
657 "\"%s\" is not a directory", dst);
658 err = -1;
659 goto out;
660 }
661
662 for (i = 0; g.gl_pathv[i] && !interrupted; i++) {
663 tmp = xstrdup(g.gl_pathv[i]);
664 if ((filename = basename(tmp)) == NULL) {
665 error("basename %s: %s", tmp, strerror(errno));
666 free(tmp);
667 err = -1;
668 goto out;
669 }
670
671 if (g.gl_matchc == 1 && dst) {
672 if (is_dir(dst)) {
673 abs_dst = path_append(dst, filename);
674 } else {
675 abs_dst = xstrdup(dst);
676 }
677 } else if (dst) {
678 abs_dst = path_append(dst, filename);
679 } else {
680 abs_dst = xstrdup(filename);
681 }
682 free(tmp);
683
684 resume |= global_aflag;
685 if (!quiet && resume)
686 mprintf("Resuming %s to %s\n",
687 g.gl_pathv[i], abs_dst);
688 else if (!quiet && !resume)
689 mprintf("Fetching %s to %s\n",
690 g.gl_pathv[i], abs_dst);
691 if (pathname_is_dir(g.gl_pathv[i]) && (rflag || global_rflag)) {
692 if (download_dir(conn, g.gl_pathv[i], abs_dst, NULL,
693 pflag || global_pflag, 1, resume,
694 fflag || global_fflag) == -1)
695 err = -1;
696 } else {
697 if (do_download(conn, g.gl_pathv[i], abs_dst, NULL,
698 pflag || global_pflag, resume,
699 fflag || global_fflag) == -1)
700 err = -1;
701 }
702 free(abs_dst);
703 abs_dst = NULL;
704 }
705
706out:
707 free(abs_src);
708 globfree(&g);
709 return(err);
710}
711
712static int
713process_put(struct sftp_conn *conn, const char *src, const char *dst,
714 const char *pwd, int pflag, int rflag, int resume, int fflag)
715{
716 char *tmp_dst = NULL;
717 char *abs_dst = NULL;
718 char *tmp = NULL, *filename = NULL;
719 glob_t g;
720 int err = 0;
721 int i, dst_is_dir = 1;
722 struct stat sb;
723
724 if (dst) {
725 tmp_dst = xstrdup(dst);
726 tmp_dst = make_absolute(tmp_dst, pwd);
727 }
728
729 memset(&g, 0, sizeof(g));
730 debug3("Looking up %s", src);
731 if (glob(src, GLOB_NOCHECK | GLOB_LIMIT | GLOB_MARK, NULL, &g)) {
732 error("File \"%s\" not found.", src);
733 err = -1;
734 goto out;
735 }
736
737 /* If we aren't fetching to pwd then stash this status for later */
738 if (tmp_dst != NULL)
739 dst_is_dir = remote_is_dir(conn, tmp_dst);
740
741 /* If multiple matches, dst may be directory or unspecified */
742 if (g.gl_matchc > 1 && tmp_dst && !dst_is_dir) {
743 error("Multiple paths match, but destination "
744 "\"%s\" is not a directory", tmp_dst);
745 err = -1;
746 goto out;
747 }
748
749 for (i = 0; g.gl_pathv[i] && !interrupted; i++) {
750 if (stat(g.gl_pathv[i], &sb) == -1) {
751 err = -1;
752 error("stat %s: %s", g.gl_pathv[i], strerror(errno));
753 continue;
754 }
755
756 tmp = xstrdup(g.gl_pathv[i]);
757 if ((filename = basename(tmp)) == NULL) {
758 error("basename %s: %s", tmp, strerror(errno));
759 free(tmp);
760 err = -1;
761 goto out;
762 }
763
764 if (g.gl_matchc == 1 && tmp_dst) {
765 /* If directory specified, append filename */
766 if (dst_is_dir)
767 abs_dst = path_append(tmp_dst, filename);
768 else
769 abs_dst = xstrdup(tmp_dst);
770 } else if (tmp_dst) {
771 abs_dst = path_append(tmp_dst, filename);
772 } else {
773 abs_dst = make_absolute(xstrdup(filename), pwd);
774 }
775 free(tmp);
776
777 resume |= global_aflag;
778 if (!quiet && resume)
779 mprintf("Resuming upload of %s to %s\n",
780 g.gl_pathv[i], abs_dst);
781 else if (!quiet && !resume)
782 mprintf("Uploading %s to %s\n",
783 g.gl_pathv[i], abs_dst);
784 if (pathname_is_dir(g.gl_pathv[i]) && (rflag || global_rflag)) {
785 if (upload_dir(conn, g.gl_pathv[i], abs_dst,
786 pflag || global_pflag, 1, resume,
787 fflag || global_fflag) == -1)
788 err = -1;
789 } else {
790 if (do_upload(conn, g.gl_pathv[i], abs_dst,
791 pflag || global_pflag, resume,
792 fflag || global_fflag) == -1)
793 err = -1;
794 }
795 free(abs_dst);
796 abs_dst = NULL;
797 }
798
799out:
800 free(abs_dst);
801 free(tmp_dst);
802 globfree(&g);
803 return(err);
804}
805
806static int
807sdirent_comp(const void *aa, const void *bb)
808{
809 const SFTP_DIRENT *a = *(const SFTP_DIRENT * const *)aa;
810 const SFTP_DIRENT *b = *(const SFTP_DIRENT * const *)bb;
811 int rmul = sort_flag & LS_REVERSE_SORT ? -1 : 1;
812
813#define NCMP(a,b) (a == b ? 0 : (a < b ? 1 : -1))
814 if (sort_flag & LS_NAME_SORT)
815 return (rmul * strcmp(a->filename, b->filename));
816 else if (sort_flag & LS_TIME_SORT)
817 return (rmul * NCMP(a->a.mtime, b->a.mtime));
818 else if (sort_flag & LS_SIZE_SORT)
819 return (rmul * NCMP(a->a.size, b->a.size));
820
821 fatal("Unknown ls sort type");
822 /*NOTREACHED*/
823 return 0;
824}
825
826/* sftp ls.1 replacement for directories */
827static int
828do_ls_dir(struct sftp_conn *conn, const char *path,
829 const char *strip_path, int lflag)
830{
831 int n;
832 u_int c = 1, colspace = 0, columns = 1;
833 SFTP_DIRENT **d;
834
835 if ((n = do_readdir(conn, path, &d)) != 0)
836 return (n);
837
838 if (!(lflag & LS_SHORT_VIEW)) {
839 u_int m = 0, width = 80;
840 struct winsize ws;
841 char *tmp;
842
843 /* Count entries for sort and find longest filename */
844 for (n = 0; d[n] != NULL; n++) {
845 if (d[n]->filename[0] != '.' || (lflag & LS_SHOW_ALL))
846 m = MAXIMUM(m, strlen(d[n]->filename));
847 }
848
849 /* Add any subpath that also needs to be counted */
850 tmp = path_strip(path, strip_path);
851 m += strlen(tmp);
852 free(tmp);
853
854 if (ioctl(fileno(stdin), TIOCGWINSZ, &ws) != -1)
855 width = ws.ws_col;
856
857 columns = width / (m + 2);
858 columns = MAXIMUM(columns, 1);
859 colspace = width / columns;
860 colspace = MINIMUM(colspace, width);
861 }
862
863 if (lflag & SORT_FLAGS) {
864 for (n = 0; d[n] != NULL; n++)
865 ; /* count entries */
866 sort_flag = lflag & (SORT_FLAGS|LS_REVERSE_SORT);
867 qsort(d, n, sizeof(*d), sdirent_comp);
868 }
869
870 for (n = 0; d[n] != NULL && !interrupted; n++) {
871 char *tmp, *fname;
872
873 if (d[n]->filename[0] == '.' && !(lflag & LS_SHOW_ALL))
874 continue;
875
876 tmp = path_append(path, d[n]->filename);
877 fname = path_strip(tmp, strip_path);
878 free(tmp);
879
880 if (lflag & LS_LONG_VIEW) {
881 if (lflag & (LS_NUMERIC_VIEW|LS_SI_UNITS)) {
882 char *lname;
883 struct stat sb;
884
885 memset(&sb, 0, sizeof(sb));
886 attrib_to_stat(&d[n]->a, &sb);
887 lname = ls_file(fname, &sb, 1,
888 (lflag & LS_SI_UNITS));
889 mprintf("%s\n", lname);
890 free(lname);
891 } else
892 mprintf("%s\n", d[n]->longname);
893 } else {
894 mprintf("%-*s", colspace, fname);
895 if (c >= columns) {
896 printf("\n");
897 c = 1;
898 } else
899 c++;
900 }
901
902 free(fname);
903 }
904
905 if (!(lflag & LS_LONG_VIEW) && (c != 1))
906 printf("\n");
907
908 free_sftp_dirents(d);
909 return (0);
910}
911
912static int
913sglob_comp(const void *aa, const void *bb)
914{
915 u_int a = *(const u_int *)aa;
916 u_int b = *(const u_int *)bb;
917 const char *ap = sort_glob->gl_pathv[a];
918 const char *bp = sort_glob->gl_pathv[b];
919#if 0
920 const struct stat *as = sort_glob->gl_statv[a];
921 const struct stat *bs = sort_glob->gl_statv[b];
922#else
923 struct stat ass, bss;
924 const struct stat *as = &ass;
925 const struct stat *bs = &bss;
926#endif
927 int rmul = sort_flag & LS_REVERSE_SORT ? -1 : 1;
928
929#define NCMP(a,b) (a == b ? 0 : (a < b ? 1 : -1))
930 if (sort_flag & LS_NAME_SORT)
931 return (rmul * strcmp(ap, bp));
932#if 1
933 if (stat(ap, &ass) == -1 || stat(bp, &bss) == -1)
934 return 0;
935#endif
936 else if (sort_flag & LS_TIME_SORT)
937 return (rmul * timespeccmp(&as->st_mtim, &bs->st_mtim, <));
938 else if (sort_flag & LS_SIZE_SORT)
939 return (rmul * NCMP(as->st_size, bs->st_size));
940
941 fatal("Unknown ls sort type");
942}
943
944/* sftp ls.1 replacement which handles path globs */
945static int
946do_globbed_ls(struct sftp_conn *conn, const char *path,
947 const char *strip_path, int lflag)
948{
949 char *fname, *lname;
950 glob_t g;
951 int err, r;
952 struct winsize ws;
953 u_int i, j, nentries, *indices = NULL, c = 1;
954 u_int colspace = 0, columns = 1, m = 0, width = 80;
955 struct stat *stp;
956#ifndef GLOB_KEEPSTAT
957 struct stat st;
958#define GLOB_KEEPSTAT 0
959#endif
960
961 memset(&g, 0, sizeof(g));
962
963 if ((r = remote_glob(conn, path,
964 GLOB_MARK|GLOB_NOCHECK|GLOB_BRACE|GLOB_KEEPSTAT|GLOB_NOSORT,
965 NULL, &g)) != 0 ||
966 (g.gl_pathc && !g.gl_matchc)) {
967 if (g.gl_pathc)
968 globfree(&g);
969 if (r == GLOB_NOSPACE) {
970 error("Can't ls: Too many matches for \"%s\"", path);
971 } else {
972 error("Can't ls: \"%s\" not found", path);
973 }
974 return -1;
975 }
976
977 if (interrupted)
978 goto out;
979
980 /*
981 * If the glob returns a single match and it is a directory,
982 * then just list its contents.
983 */
984 if (g.gl_matchc == 1 &&
985#if GLOB_KEEPSTAT != 0
986 (stp = g.gl_statv[0]) != NULL &&
987#else
988 lstat(g.gl_pathv[0], stp = &st) != -1 &&
989#endif
990 S_ISDIR(stp->st_mode)) {
991 err = do_ls_dir(conn, g.gl_pathv[0], strip_path, lflag);
992 globfree(&g);
993 return err;
994 }
995
996 if (ioctl(fileno(stdin), TIOCGWINSZ, &ws) != -1)
997 width = ws.ws_col;
998
999 if (!(lflag & LS_SHORT_VIEW)) {
1000 /* Count entries for sort and find longest filename */
1001 for (i = 0; g.gl_pathv[i]; i++)
1002 m = MAXIMUM(m, strlen(g.gl_pathv[i]));
1003
1004 columns = width / (m + 2);
1005 columns = MAXIMUM(columns, 1);
1006 colspace = width / columns;
1007 }
1008
1009 /*
1010 * Sorting: rather than mess with the contents of glob_t, prepare
1011 * an array of indices into it and sort that. For the usual
1012 * unsorted case, the indices are just the identity 1=1, 2=2, etc.
1013 */
1014 for (nentries = 0; g.gl_pathv[nentries] != NULL; nentries++)
1015 ; /* count entries */
1016 indices = calloc(nentries, sizeof(*indices));
1017 for (i = 0; i < nentries; i++)
1018 indices[i] = i;
1019
1020 if (lflag & SORT_FLAGS) {
1021 sort_glob = &g;
1022 sort_flag = lflag & (SORT_FLAGS|LS_REVERSE_SORT);
1023 qsort(indices, nentries, sizeof(*indices), sglob_comp);
1024 sort_glob = NULL;
1025 }
1026
1027 for (j = 0; j < nentries && !interrupted; j++) {
1028 i = indices[j];
1029 fname = path_strip(g.gl_pathv[i], strip_path);
1030 if (lflag & LS_LONG_VIEW) {
1031#if GLOB_KEEPSTAT != 0
1032 stp = g.gl_statv[i];
1033#else
1034 if (lstat(g.gl_pathv[i], stp = &st) == -1)
1035 stp = NULL;
1036#endif
1037 if (stp == NULL) {
1038 error("no stat information for %s", fname);
1039 continue;
1040 }
1041 lname = ls_file(fname, stp, 1, (lflag & LS_SI_UNITS));
1042 mprintf("%s\n", lname);
1043 free(lname);
1044 } else {
1045 mprintf("%-*s", colspace, fname);
1046 if (c >= columns) {
1047 printf("\n");
1048 c = 1;
1049 } else
1050 c++;
1051 }
1052 free(fname);
1053 }
1054
1055 if (!(lflag & LS_LONG_VIEW) && (c != 1))
1056 printf("\n");
1057
1058 out:
1059 if (g.gl_pathc)
1060 globfree(&g);
1061 free(indices);
1062
1063 return 0;
1064}
1065
1066static int
1067do_df(struct sftp_conn *conn, const char *path, int hflag, int iflag)
1068{
1069 struct sftp_statvfs st;
1070 char s_used[FMT_SCALED_STRSIZE], s_avail[FMT_SCALED_STRSIZE];
1071 char s_root[FMT_SCALED_STRSIZE], s_total[FMT_SCALED_STRSIZE];
1072 char s_icapacity[16], s_dcapacity[16];
1073
1074 if (do_statvfs(conn, path, &st, 1) == -1)
1075 return -1;
1076 if (st.f_files == 0)
1077 strlcpy(s_icapacity, "ERR", sizeof(s_icapacity));
1078 else {
1079 snprintf(s_icapacity, sizeof(s_icapacity), "%3llu%%",
1080 (unsigned long long)(100 * (st.f_files - st.f_ffree) /
1081 st.f_files));
1082 }
1083 if (st.f_blocks == 0)
1084 strlcpy(s_dcapacity, "ERR", sizeof(s_dcapacity));
1085 else {
1086 snprintf(s_dcapacity, sizeof(s_dcapacity), "%3llu%%",
1087 (unsigned long long)(100 * (st.f_blocks - st.f_bfree) /
1088 st.f_blocks));
1089 }
1090 if (iflag) {
1091 printf(" Inodes Used Avail "
1092 "(root) %%Capacity\n");
1093 printf("%11llu %11llu %11llu %11llu %s\n",
1094 (unsigned long long)st.f_files,
1095 (unsigned long long)(st.f_files - st.f_ffree),
1096 (unsigned long long)st.f_favail,
1097 (unsigned long long)st.f_ffree, s_icapacity);
1098 } else if (hflag) {
1099 strlcpy(s_used, "error", sizeof(s_used));
1100 strlcpy(s_avail, "error", sizeof(s_avail));
1101 strlcpy(s_root, "error", sizeof(s_root));
1102 strlcpy(s_total, "error", sizeof(s_total));
1103 fmt_scaled((st.f_blocks - st.f_bfree) * st.f_frsize, s_used);
1104 fmt_scaled(st.f_bavail * st.f_frsize, s_avail);
1105 fmt_scaled(st.f_bfree * st.f_frsize, s_root);
1106 fmt_scaled(st.f_blocks * st.f_frsize, s_total);
1107 printf(" Size Used Avail (root) %%Capacity\n");
1108 printf("%7sB %7sB %7sB %7sB %s\n",
1109 s_total, s_used, s_avail, s_root, s_dcapacity);
1110 } else {
1111 printf(" Size Used Avail "
1112 "(root) %%Capacity\n");
1113 printf("%12llu %12llu %12llu %12llu %s\n",
1114 (unsigned long long)(st.f_frsize * st.f_blocks / 1024),
1115 (unsigned long long)(st.f_frsize *
1116 (st.f_blocks - st.f_bfree) / 1024),
1117 (unsigned long long)(st.f_frsize * st.f_bavail / 1024),
1118 (unsigned long long)(st.f_frsize * st.f_bfree / 1024),
1119 s_dcapacity);
1120 }
1121 return 0;
1122}
1123
1124/*
1125 * Undo escaping of glob sequences in place. Used to undo extra escaping
1126 * applied in makeargv() when the string is destined for a function that
1127 * does not glob it.
1128 */
1129static void
1130undo_glob_escape(char *s)
1131{
1132 size_t i, j;
1133
1134 for (i = j = 0;;) {
1135 if (s[i] == '\0') {
1136 s[j] = '\0';
1137 return;
1138 }
1139 if (s[i] != '\\') {
1140 s[j++] = s[i++];
1141 continue;
1142 }
1143 /* s[i] == '\\' */
1144 ++i;
1145 switch (s[i]) {
1146 case '?':
1147 case '[':
1148 case '*':
1149 case '\\':
1150 s[j++] = s[i++];
1151 break;
1152 case '\0':
1153 s[j++] = '\\';
1154 s[j] = '\0';
1155 return;
1156 default:
1157 s[j++] = '\\';
1158 s[j++] = s[i++];
1159 break;
1160 }
1161 }
1162}
1163
1164/*
1165 * Split a string into an argument vector using sh(1)-style quoting,
1166 * comment and escaping rules, but with some tweaks to handle glob(3)
1167 * wildcards.
1168 * The "sloppy" flag allows for recovery from missing terminating quote, for
1169 * use in parsing incomplete commandlines during tab autocompletion.
1170 *
1171 * Returns NULL on error or a NULL-terminated array of arguments.
1172 *
1173 * If "lastquote" is not NULL, the quoting character used for the last
1174 * argument is placed in *lastquote ("\0", "'" or "\"").
1175 *
1176 * If "terminated" is not NULL, *terminated will be set to 1 when the
1177 * last argument's quote has been properly terminated or 0 otherwise.
1178 * This parameter is only of use if "sloppy" is set.
1179 */
1180#define MAXARGS 128
1181#define MAXARGLEN 8192
1182static char **
1183makeargv(const char *arg, int *argcp, int sloppy, char *lastquote,
1184 u_int *terminated)
1185{
1186 int argc, quot;
1187 size_t i, j;
1188 static char argvs[MAXARGLEN];
1189 static char *argv[MAXARGS + 1];
1190 enum { MA_START, MA_SQUOTE, MA_DQUOTE, MA_UNQUOTED } state, q;
1191
1192 *argcp = argc = 0;
1193 if (strlen(arg) > sizeof(argvs) - 1) {
1194 args_too_longs:
1195 error("string too long");
1196 return NULL;
1197 }
1198 if (terminated != NULL)
1199 *terminated = 1;
1200 if (lastquote != NULL)
1201 *lastquote = '\0';
1202 state = MA_START;
1203 i = j = 0;
1204 for (;;) {
1205 if ((size_t)argc >= sizeof(argv) / sizeof(*argv)){
1206 error("Too many arguments.");
1207 return NULL;
1208 }
1209 if (isspace((unsigned char)arg[i])) {
1210 if (state == MA_UNQUOTED) {
1211 /* Terminate current argument */
1212 argvs[j++] = '\0';
1213 argc++;
1214 state = MA_START;
1215 } else if (state != MA_START)
1216 argvs[j++] = arg[i];
1217 } else if (arg[i] == '"' || arg[i] == '\'') {
1218 q = arg[i] == '"' ? MA_DQUOTE : MA_SQUOTE;
1219 if (state == MA_START) {
1220 argv[argc] = argvs + j;
1221 state = q;
1222 if (lastquote != NULL)
1223 *lastquote = arg[i];
1224 } else if (state == MA_UNQUOTED)
1225 state = q;
1226 else if (state == q)
1227 state = MA_UNQUOTED;
1228 else
1229 argvs[j++] = arg[i];
1230 } else if (arg[i] == '\\') {
1231 if (state == MA_SQUOTE || state == MA_DQUOTE) {
1232 quot = state == MA_SQUOTE ? '\'' : '"';
1233 /* Unescape quote we are in */
1234 /* XXX support \n and friends? */
1235 if (arg[i + 1] == quot) {
1236 i++;
1237 argvs[j++] = arg[i];
1238 } else if (arg[i + 1] == '?' ||
1239 arg[i + 1] == '[' || arg[i + 1] == '*') {
1240 /*
1241 * Special case for sftp: append
1242 * double-escaped glob sequence -
1243 * glob will undo one level of
1244 * escaping. NB. string can grow here.
1245 */
1246 if (j >= sizeof(argvs) - 5)
1247 goto args_too_longs;
1248 argvs[j++] = '\\';
1249 argvs[j++] = arg[i++];
1250 argvs[j++] = '\\';
1251 argvs[j++] = arg[i];
1252 } else {
1253 argvs[j++] = arg[i++];
1254 argvs[j++] = arg[i];
1255 }
1256 } else {
1257 if (state == MA_START) {
1258 argv[argc] = argvs + j;
1259 state = MA_UNQUOTED;
1260 if (lastquote != NULL)
1261 *lastquote = '\0';
1262 }
1263 if (arg[i + 1] == '?' || arg[i + 1] == '[' ||
1264 arg[i + 1] == '*' || arg[i + 1] == '\\') {
1265 /*
1266 * Special case for sftp: append
1267 * escaped glob sequence -
1268 * glob will undo one level of
1269 * escaping.
1270 */
1271 argvs[j++] = arg[i++];
1272 argvs[j++] = arg[i];
1273 } else {
1274 /* Unescape everything */
1275 /* XXX support \n and friends? */
1276 i++;
1277 argvs[j++] = arg[i];
1278 }
1279 }
1280 } else if (arg[i] == '#') {
1281 if (state == MA_SQUOTE || state == MA_DQUOTE)
1282 argvs[j++] = arg[i];
1283 else
1284 goto string_done;
1285 } else if (arg[i] == '\0') {
1286 if (state == MA_SQUOTE || state == MA_DQUOTE) {
1287 if (sloppy) {
1288 state = MA_UNQUOTED;
1289 if (terminated != NULL)
1290 *terminated = 0;
1291 goto string_done;
1292 }
1293 error("Unterminated quoted argument");
1294 return NULL;
1295 }
1296 string_done:
1297 if (state == MA_UNQUOTED) {
1298 argvs[j++] = '\0';
1299 argc++;
1300 }
1301 break;
1302 } else {
1303 if (state == MA_START) {
1304 argv[argc] = argvs + j;
1305 state = MA_UNQUOTED;
1306 if (lastquote != NULL)
1307 *lastquote = '\0';
1308 }
1309 if ((state == MA_SQUOTE || state == MA_DQUOTE) &&
1310 (arg[i] == '?' || arg[i] == '[' || arg[i] == '*')) {
1311 /*
1312 * Special case for sftp: escape quoted
1313 * glob(3) wildcards. NB. string can grow
1314 * here.
1315 */
1316 if (j >= sizeof(argvs) - 3)
1317 goto args_too_longs;
1318 argvs[j++] = '\\';
1319 argvs[j++] = arg[i];
1320 } else
1321 argvs[j++] = arg[i];
1322 }
1323 i++;
1324 }
1325 *argcp = argc;
1326 return argv;
1327}
1328
1329static int
1330parse_args(const char **cpp, int *ignore_errors, int *disable_echo, int *aflag,
1331 int *fflag, int *hflag, int *iflag, int *lflag, int *pflag,
1332 int *rflag, int *sflag,
1333 unsigned long *n_arg, char **path1, char **path2)
1334{
1335 const char *cmd, *cp = *cpp;
1336 char *cp2, **argv;
1337 int base = 0;
1338 long l;
1339 int path1_mandatory = 0, i, cmdnum, optidx, argc;
1340
1341 /* Skip leading whitespace */
1342 cp = cp + strspn(cp, WHITESPACE);
1343
1344 /*
1345 * Check for leading '-' (disable error processing) and '@' (suppress
1346 * command echo)
1347 */
1348 *ignore_errors = 0;
1349 *disable_echo = 0;
1350 for (;*cp != '\0'; cp++) {
1351 if (*cp == '-') {
1352 *ignore_errors = 1;
1353 } else if (*cp == '@') {
1354 *disable_echo = 1;
1355 } else {
1356 /* all other characters terminate prefix processing */
1357 break;
1358 }
1359 }
1360 cp = cp + strspn(cp, WHITESPACE);
1361
1362 /* Ignore blank lines and lines which begin with comment '#' char */
1363 if (*cp == '\0' || *cp == '#')
1364 return (0);
1365
1366 if ((argv = makeargv(cp, &argc, 0, NULL, NULL)) == NULL)
1367 return -1;
1368
1369 /* Figure out which command we have */
1370 for (i = 0; cmds[i].c != NULL; i++) {
1371 if (argv[0] != NULL && strcasecmp(cmds[i].c, argv[0]) == 0)
1372 break;
1373 }
1374 cmdnum = cmds[i].n;
1375 cmd = cmds[i].c;
1376
1377 /* Special case */
1378 if (*cp == '!') {
1379 cp++;
1380 cmdnum = I_SHELL;
1381 } else if (cmdnum == -1) {
1382 error("Invalid command.");
1383 return -1;
1384 }
1385
1386 /* Get arguments and parse flags */
1387 *aflag = *fflag = *hflag = *iflag = *lflag = *pflag = 0;
1388 *rflag = *sflag = 0;
1389 *path1 = *path2 = NULL;
1390 optidx = 1;
1391 switch (cmdnum) {
1392 case I_GET:
1393 case I_REGET:
1394 case I_REPUT:
1395 case I_PUT:
1396 if ((optidx = parse_getput_flags(cmd, argv, argc,
1397 aflag, fflag, pflag, rflag)) == -1)
1398 return -1;
1399 /* Get first pathname (mandatory) */
1400 if (argc - optidx < 1) {
1401 error("You must specify at least one path after a "
1402 "%s command.", cmd);
1403 return -1;
1404 }
1405 *path1 = xstrdup(argv[optidx]);
1406 /* Get second pathname (optional) */
1407 if (argc - optidx > 1) {
1408 *path2 = xstrdup(argv[optidx + 1]);
1409 /* Destination is not globbed */
1410 undo_glob_escape(*path2);
1411 }
1412 break;
1413 case I_LINK:
1414 if ((optidx = parse_link_flags(cmd, argv, argc, sflag)) == -1)
1415 return -1;
1416 goto parse_two_paths;
1417 case I_RENAME:
1418 if ((optidx = parse_rename_flags(cmd, argv, argc, lflag)) == -1)
1419 return -1;
1420 goto parse_two_paths;
1421 case I_SYMLINK:
1422 if ((optidx = parse_no_flags(cmd, argv, argc)) == -1)
1423 return -1;
1424 parse_two_paths:
1425 if (argc - optidx < 2) {
1426 error("You must specify two paths after a %s "
1427 "command.", cmd);
1428 return -1;
1429 }
1430 *path1 = xstrdup(argv[optidx]);
1431 *path2 = xstrdup(argv[optidx + 1]);
1432 /* Paths are not globbed */
1433 undo_glob_escape(*path1);
1434 undo_glob_escape(*path2);
1435 break;
1436 case I_RM:
1437 case I_MKDIR:
1438 case I_RMDIR:
1439 case I_LMKDIR:
1440 path1_mandatory = 1;
1441 /* FALLTHROUGH */
1442 case I_CHDIR:
1443 case I_LCHDIR:
1444 if ((optidx = parse_no_flags(cmd, argv, argc)) == -1)
1445 return -1;
1446 /* Get pathname (mandatory) */
1447 if (argc - optidx < 1) {
1448 if (!path1_mandatory)
1449 break; /* return a NULL path1 */
1450 error("You must specify a path after a %s command.",
1451 cmd);
1452 return -1;
1453 }
1454 *path1 = xstrdup(argv[optidx]);
1455 /* Only "rm" globs */
1456 if (cmdnum != I_RM)
1457 undo_glob_escape(*path1);
1458 break;
1459 case I_DF:
1460 if ((optidx = parse_df_flags(cmd, argv, argc, hflag,
1461 iflag)) == -1)
1462 return -1;
1463 /* Default to current directory if no path specified */
1464 if (argc - optidx < 1)
1465 *path1 = NULL;
1466 else {
1467 *path1 = xstrdup(argv[optidx]);
1468 undo_glob_escape(*path1);
1469 }
1470 break;
1471 case I_LS:
1472 if ((optidx = parse_ls_flags(argv, argc, lflag)) == -1)
1473 return(-1);
1474 /* Path is optional */
1475 if (argc - optidx > 0)
1476 *path1 = xstrdup(argv[optidx]);
1477 break;
1478 case I_LLS:
1479 /* Skip ls command and following whitespace */
1480 cp = cp + strlen(cmd) + strspn(cp, WHITESPACE);
1481 case I_SHELL:
1482 /* Uses the rest of the line */
1483 break;
1484 case I_LUMASK:
1485 case I_CHMOD:
1486 base = 8;
1487 /* FALLTHROUGH */
1488 case I_CHOWN:
1489 case I_CHGRP:
1490 if ((optidx = parse_ch_flags(cmd, argv, argc, hflag)) == -1)
1491 return -1;
1492 /* Get numeric arg (mandatory) */
1493 if (argc - optidx < 1)
1494 goto need_num_arg;
1495 errno = 0;
1496 l = strtol(argv[optidx], &cp2, base);
1497 if (cp2 == argv[optidx] || *cp2 != '\0' ||
1498 ((l == LONG_MIN || l == LONG_MAX) && errno == ERANGE) ||
1499 l < 0) {
1500 need_num_arg:
1501 error("You must supply a numeric argument "
1502 "to the %s command.", cmd);
1503 return -1;
1504 }
1505 *n_arg = l;
1506 if (cmdnum == I_LUMASK)
1507 break;
1508 /* Get pathname (mandatory) */
1509 if (argc - optidx < 2) {
1510 error("You must specify a path after a %s command.",
1511 cmd);
1512 return -1;
1513 }
1514 *path1 = xstrdup(argv[optidx + 1]);
1515 break;
1516 case I_QUIT:
1517 case I_PWD:
1518 case I_LPWD:
1519 case I_HELP:
1520 case I_VERSION:
1521 case I_PROGRESS:
1522 if ((optidx = parse_no_flags(cmd, argv, argc)) == -1)
1523 return -1;
1524 break;
1525 default:
1526 fatal("Command not implemented");
1527 }
1528
1529 *cpp = cp;
1530 return(cmdnum);
1531}
1532
1533static int
1534parse_dispatch_command(struct sftp_conn *conn, const char *cmd, char **pwd,
1535 const char *startdir, int err_abort, int echo_command)
1536{
1537 const char *ocmd = cmd;
1538 char *path1, *path2, *tmp;
1539 int ignore_errors = 0, disable_echo = 1;
1540 int aflag = 0, fflag = 0, hflag = 0, iflag = 0;
1541 int lflag = 0, pflag = 0, rflag = 0, sflag = 0;
1542 int cmdnum, i;
1543 unsigned long n_arg = 0;
1544 Attrib a, *aa;
1545 char path_buf[PATH_MAX];
1546 int err = 0;
1547 glob_t g;
1548
1549 pflag = 0; /* XXX gcc */
1550 lflag = 0; /* XXX gcc */
1551 iflag = 0; /* XXX gcc */
1552 hflag = 0; /* XXX gcc */
1553 n_arg = 0; /* XXX gcc */
1554
1555 path1 = path2 = NULL;
1556 cmdnum = parse_args(&cmd, &ignore_errors, &disable_echo, &aflag, &fflag,
1557 &hflag, &iflag, &lflag, &pflag, &rflag, &sflag, &n_arg,
1558 &path1, &path2);
1559 if (ignore_errors != 0)
1560 err_abort = 0;
1561
1562 if (echo_command && !disable_echo)
1563 mprintf("sftp> %s\n", ocmd);
1564
1565 memset(&g, 0, sizeof(g));
1566
1567 /* Perform command */
1568 switch (cmdnum) {
1569 case 0:
1570 /* Blank line */
1571 break;
1572 case -1:
1573 /* Unrecognized command */
1574 err = -1;
1575 break;
1576 case I_REGET:
1577 aflag = 1;
1578 /* FALLTHROUGH */
1579 case I_GET:
1580 err = process_get(conn, path1, path2, *pwd, pflag,
1581 rflag, aflag, fflag);
1582 break;
1583 case I_REPUT:
1584 aflag = 1;
1585 /* FALLTHROUGH */
1586 case I_PUT:
1587 err = process_put(conn, path1, path2, *pwd, pflag,
1588 rflag, aflag, fflag);
1589 break;
1590 case I_RENAME:
1591 path1 = make_absolute(path1, *pwd);
1592 path2 = make_absolute(path2, *pwd);
1593 err = do_rename(conn, path1, path2, lflag);
1594 break;
1595 case I_SYMLINK:
1596 sflag = 1;
1597 /* FALLTHROUGH */
1598 case I_LINK:
1599 if (!sflag)
1600 path1 = make_absolute(path1, *pwd);
1601 path2 = make_absolute(path2, *pwd);
1602 err = (sflag ? do_symlink : do_hardlink)(conn, path1, path2);
1603 break;
1604 case I_RM:
1605 path1 = make_absolute(path1, *pwd);
1606 remote_glob(conn, path1, GLOB_NOCHECK, NULL, &g);
1607 for (i = 0; g.gl_pathv[i] && !interrupted; i++) {
1608 if (!quiet)
1609 mprintf("Removing %s\n", g.gl_pathv[i]);
1610 err = do_rm(conn, g.gl_pathv[i]);
1611 if (err != 0 && err_abort)
1612 break;
1613 }
1614 break;
1615 case I_MKDIR:
1616 path1 = make_absolute(path1, *pwd);
1617 attrib_clear(&a);
1618 a.flags |= SSH2_FILEXFER_ATTR_PERMISSIONS;
1619 a.perm = 0777;
1620 err = do_mkdir(conn, path1, &a, 1);
1621 break;
1622 case I_RMDIR:
1623 path1 = make_absolute(path1, *pwd);
1624 err = do_rmdir(conn, path1);
1625 break;
1626 case I_CHDIR:
1627 if (path1 == NULL || *path1 == '\0')
1628 path1 = xstrdup(startdir);
1629 path1 = make_absolute(path1, *pwd);
1630 if ((tmp = do_realpath(conn, path1)) == NULL) {
1631 err = 1;
1632 break;
1633 }
1634 if ((aa = do_stat(conn, tmp, 0)) == NULL) {
1635 free(tmp);
1636 err = 1;
1637 break;
1638 }
1639 if (!(aa->flags & SSH2_FILEXFER_ATTR_PERMISSIONS)) {
1640 error("Can't change directory: Can't check target");
1641 free(tmp);
1642 err = 1;
1643 break;
1644 }
1645 if (!S_ISDIR(aa->perm)) {
1646 error("Can't change directory: \"%s\" is not "
1647 "a directory", tmp);
1648 free(tmp);
1649 err = 1;
1650 break;
1651 }
1652 free(*pwd);
1653 *pwd = tmp;
1654 break;
1655 case I_LS:
1656 if (!path1) {
1657 do_ls_dir(conn, *pwd, *pwd, lflag);
1658 break;
1659 }
1660
1661 /* Strip pwd off beginning of non-absolute paths */
1662 tmp = NULL;
1663 if (!path_absolute(path1))
1664 tmp = *pwd;
1665
1666 path1 = make_absolute(path1, *pwd);
1667 err = do_globbed_ls(conn, path1, tmp, lflag);
1668 break;
1669 case I_DF:
1670 /* Default to current directory if no path specified */
1671 if (path1 == NULL)
1672 path1 = xstrdup(*pwd);
1673 path1 = make_absolute(path1, *pwd);
1674 err = do_df(conn, path1, hflag, iflag);
1675 break;
1676 case I_LCHDIR:
1677 if (path1 == NULL || *path1 == '\0')
1678 path1 = xstrdup("~");
1679 tmp = tilde_expand_filename(path1, getuid());
1680 free(path1);
1681 path1 = tmp;
1682 if (chdir(path1) == -1) {
1683 error("Couldn't change local directory to "
1684 "\"%s\": %s", path1, strerror(errno));
1685 err = 1;
1686 }
1687 break;
1688 case I_LMKDIR:
1689 if (mkdir(path1, 0777) == -1) {
1690 error("Couldn't create local directory "
1691 "\"%s\": %s", path1, strerror(errno));
1692 err = 1;
1693 }
1694 break;
1695 case I_LLS:
1696 local_do_ls(cmd);
1697 break;
1698 case I_SHELL:
1699 local_do_shell(cmd);
1700 break;
1701 case I_LUMASK:
1702 umask(n_arg);
1703 printf("Local umask: %03lo\n", n_arg);
1704 break;
1705 case I_CHMOD:
1706 path1 = make_absolute(path1, *pwd);
1707 attrib_clear(&a);
1708 a.flags |= SSH2_FILEXFER_ATTR_PERMISSIONS;
1709 a.perm = n_arg;
1710 remote_glob(conn, path1, GLOB_NOCHECK, NULL, &g);
1711 for (i = 0; g.gl_pathv[i] && !interrupted; i++) {
1712 if (!quiet)
1713 mprintf("Changing mode on %s\n",
1714 g.gl_pathv[i]);
1715 err = (hflag ? do_lsetstat : do_setstat)(conn,
1716 g.gl_pathv[i], &a);
1717 if (err != 0 && err_abort)
1718 break;
1719 }
1720 break;
1721 case I_CHOWN:
1722 case I_CHGRP:
1723 path1 = make_absolute(path1, *pwd);
1724 remote_glob(conn, path1, GLOB_NOCHECK, NULL, &g);
1725 for (i = 0; g.gl_pathv[i] && !interrupted; i++) {
1726 if (!(aa = (hflag ? do_lstat : do_stat)(conn,
1727 g.gl_pathv[i], 0))) {
1728 if (err_abort) {
1729 err = -1;
1730 break;
1731 } else
1732 continue;
1733 }
1734 if (!(aa->flags & SSH2_FILEXFER_ATTR_UIDGID)) {
1735 error("Can't get current ownership of "
1736 "remote file \"%s\"", g.gl_pathv[i]);
1737 if (err_abort) {
1738 err = -1;
1739 break;
1740 } else
1741 continue;
1742 }
1743 aa->flags &= SSH2_FILEXFER_ATTR_UIDGID;
1744 if (cmdnum == I_CHOWN) {
1745 if (!quiet)
1746 mprintf("Changing owner on %s\n",
1747 g.gl_pathv[i]);
1748 aa->uid = n_arg;
1749 } else {
1750 if (!quiet)
1751 mprintf("Changing group on %s\n",
1752 g.gl_pathv[i]);
1753 aa->gid = n_arg;
1754 }
1755 err = (hflag ? do_lsetstat : do_setstat)(conn,
1756 g.gl_pathv[i], aa);
1757 if (err != 0 && err_abort)
1758 break;
1759 }
1760 break;
1761 case I_PWD:
1762 mprintf("Remote working directory: %s\n", *pwd);
1763 break;
1764 case I_LPWD:
1765 if (!getcwd(path_buf, sizeof(path_buf))) {
1766 error("Couldn't get local cwd: %s", strerror(errno));
1767 err = -1;
1768 break;
1769 }
1770 mprintf("Local working directory: %s\n", path_buf);
1771 break;
1772 case I_QUIT:
1773 /* Processed below */
1774 break;
1775 case I_HELP:
1776 help();
1777 break;
1778 case I_VERSION:
1779 printf("SFTP protocol version %u\n", sftp_proto_version(conn));
1780 break;
1781 case I_PROGRESS:
1782 showprogress = !showprogress;
1783 if (showprogress)
1784 printf("Progress meter enabled\n");
1785 else
1786 printf("Progress meter disabled\n");
1787 break;
1788 default:
1789 fatal("%d is not implemented", cmdnum);
1790 }
1791
1792 if (g.gl_pathc)
1793 globfree(&g);
1794 free(path1);
1795 free(path2);
1796
1797 /* If an unignored error occurs in batch mode we should abort. */
1798 if (err_abort && err != 0)
1799 return (-1);
1800 else if (cmdnum == I_QUIT)
1801 return (1);
1802
1803 return (0);
1804}
1805
1806static const char *
1807prompt(EditLine *el)
1808{
1809 return ("sftp> ");
1810}
1811
1812/* Display entries in 'list' after skipping the first 'len' chars */
1813static void
1814complete_display(char **list, u_int len)
1815{
1816 u_int y, m = 0, width = 80, columns = 1, colspace = 0, llen;
1817 struct winsize ws;
1818 const char *tmp;
1819
1820 /* Count entries for sort and find longest */
1821 for (y = 0; list[y]; y++)
1822 m = MAXIMUM(m, strlen(list[y]));
1823
1824 if (ioctl(fileno(stdin), TIOCGWINSZ, &ws) != -1)
1825 width = ws.ws_col;
1826
1827 m = m > len ? m - len : 0;
1828 columns = width / (m + 2);
1829 columns = MAXIMUM(columns, 1);
1830 colspace = width / columns;
1831 colspace = MINIMUM(colspace, width);
1832
1833 printf("\n");
1834 m = 1;
1835 for (y = 0; list[y]; y++) {
1836 llen = strlen(list[y]);
1837 tmp = llen > len ? list[y] + len : "";
1838 mprintf("%-*s", colspace, tmp);
1839 if (m >= columns) {
1840 printf("\n");
1841 m = 1;
1842 } else
1843 m++;
1844 }
1845 printf("\n");
1846}
1847
1848/*
1849 * Given a "list" of words that begin with a common prefix of "word",
1850 * attempt to find an autocompletion to extends "word" by the next
1851 * characters common to all entries in "list".
1852 */
1853static char *
1854complete_ambiguous(const char *word, char **list, size_t count)
1855{
1856 if (word == NULL)
1857 return NULL;
1858
1859 if (count > 0) {
1860 u_int y, matchlen = strlen(list[0]);
1861
1862 /* Find length of common stem */
1863 for (y = 1; list[y]; y++) {
1864 u_int x;
1865
1866 for (x = 0; x < matchlen; x++)
1867 if (list[0][x] != list[y][x])
1868 break;
1869
1870 matchlen = x;
1871 }
1872
1873 if (matchlen > strlen(word)) {
1874 char *tmp = xstrdup(list[0]);
1875
1876 tmp[matchlen] = '\0';
1877 return tmp;
1878 }
1879 }
1880
1881 return xstrdup(word);
1882}
1883
1884/* Autocomplete a sftp command */
1885static int
1886complete_cmd_parse(EditLine *el, char *cmd, int lastarg, char quote,
1887 int terminated)
1888{
1889 u_int y, count = 0, cmdlen, tmplen;
1890 char *tmp, **list, argterm[3];
1891 const LineInfo *lf;
1892
1893 list = xcalloc((sizeof(cmds) / sizeof(*cmds)) + 1, sizeof(char *));
1894
1895 /* No command specified: display all available commands */
1896 if (cmd == NULL) {
1897 for (y = 0; cmds[y].c; y++)
1898 list[count++] = xstrdup(cmds[y].c);
1899
1900 list[count] = NULL;
1901 complete_display(list, 0);
1902
1903 for (y = 0; list[y] != NULL; y++)
1904 free(list[y]);
1905 free(list);
1906 return count;
1907 }
1908
1909 /* Prepare subset of commands that start with "cmd" */
1910 cmdlen = strlen(cmd);
1911 for (y = 0; cmds[y].c; y++) {
1912 if (!strncasecmp(cmd, cmds[y].c, cmdlen))
1913 list[count++] = xstrdup(cmds[y].c);
1914 }
1915 list[count] = NULL;
1916
1917 if (count == 0) {
1918 free(list);
1919 return 0;
1920 }
1921
1922 /* Complete ambiguous command */
1923 tmp = complete_ambiguous(cmd, list, count);
1924 if (count > 1)
1925 complete_display(list, 0);
1926
1927 for (y = 0; list[y]; y++)
1928 free(list[y]);
1929 free(list);
1930
1931 if (tmp != NULL) {
1932 tmplen = strlen(tmp);
1933 cmdlen = strlen(cmd);
1934 /* If cmd may be extended then do so */
1935 if (tmplen > cmdlen)
1936 if (el_insertstr(el, tmp + cmdlen) == -1)
1937 fatal("el_insertstr failed.");
1938 lf = el_line(el);
1939 /* Terminate argument cleanly */
1940 if (count == 1) {
1941 y = 0;
1942 if (!terminated)
1943 argterm[y++] = quote;
1944 if (lastarg || *(lf->cursor) != ' ')
1945 argterm[y++] = ' ';
1946 argterm[y] = '\0';
1947 if (y > 0 && el_insertstr(el, argterm) == -1)
1948 fatal("el_insertstr failed.");
1949 }
1950 free(tmp);
1951 }
1952
1953 return count;
1954}
1955
1956/*
1957 * Determine whether a particular sftp command's arguments (if any)
1958 * represent local or remote files.
1959 */
1960static int
1961complete_is_remote(char *cmd) {
1962 int i;
1963
1964 if (cmd == NULL)
1965 return -1;
1966
1967 for (i = 0; cmds[i].c; i++) {
1968 if (!strncasecmp(cmd, cmds[i].c, strlen(cmds[i].c)))
1969 return cmds[i].t;
1970 }
1971
1972 return -1;
1973}
1974
1975/* Autocomplete a filename "file" */
1976static int
1977complete_match(EditLine *el, struct sftp_conn *conn, char *remote_path,
1978 char *file, int remote, int lastarg, char quote, int terminated)
1979{
1980 glob_t g;
1981 char *tmp, *tmp2, ins[8];
1982 u_int i, hadglob, pwdlen, len, tmplen, filelen, cesc, isesc, isabs;
1983 int clen;
1984 const LineInfo *lf;
1985
1986 /* Glob from "file" location */
1987 if (file == NULL)
1988 tmp = xstrdup("*");
1989 else
1990 xasprintf(&tmp, "%s*", file);
1991
1992 /* Check if the path is absolute. */
1993 isabs = path_absolute(tmp);
1994
1995 memset(&g, 0, sizeof(g));
1996 if (remote != LOCAL) {
1997 tmp = make_absolute(tmp, remote_path);
1998 remote_glob(conn, tmp, GLOB_DOOFFS|GLOB_MARK, NULL, &g);
1999 } else
2000 glob(tmp, GLOB_LIMIT|GLOB_DOOFFS|GLOB_MARK, NULL, &g);
2001
2002 /* Determine length of pwd so we can trim completion display */
2003 for (hadglob = tmplen = pwdlen = 0; tmp[tmplen] != 0; tmplen++) {
2004 /* Terminate counting on first unescaped glob metacharacter */
2005 if (tmp[tmplen] == '*' || tmp[tmplen] == '?') {
2006 if (tmp[tmplen] != '*' || tmp[tmplen + 1] != '\0')
2007 hadglob = 1;
2008 break;
2009 }
2010 if (tmp[tmplen] == '\\' && tmp[tmplen + 1] != '\0')
2011 tmplen++;
2012 if (tmp[tmplen] == '/')
2013 pwdlen = tmplen + 1; /* track last seen '/' */
2014 }
2015 free(tmp);
2016 tmp = NULL;
2017
2018 if (g.gl_matchc == 0)
2019 goto out;
2020
2021 if (g.gl_matchc > 1)
2022 complete_display(g.gl_pathv, pwdlen);
2023
2024 /* Don't try to extend globs */
2025 if (file == NULL || hadglob)
2026 goto out;
2027
2028 tmp2 = complete_ambiguous(file, g.gl_pathv, g.gl_matchc);
2029 tmp = path_strip(tmp2, isabs ? NULL : remote_path);
2030 free(tmp2);
2031
2032 if (tmp == NULL)
2033 goto out;
2034
2035 tmplen = strlen(tmp);
2036 filelen = strlen(file);
2037
2038 /* Count the number of escaped characters in the input string. */
2039 cesc = isesc = 0;
2040 for (i = 0; i < filelen; i++) {
2041 if (!isesc && file[i] == '\\' && i + 1 < filelen){
2042 isesc = 1;
2043 cesc++;
2044 } else
2045 isesc = 0;
2046 }
2047
2048 if (tmplen > (filelen - cesc)) {
2049 tmp2 = tmp + filelen - cesc;
2050 len = strlen(tmp2);
2051 /* quote argument on way out */
2052 for (i = 0; i < len; i += clen) {
2053 if ((clen = mblen(tmp2 + i, len - i)) < 0 ||
2054 (size_t)clen > sizeof(ins) - 2)
2055 fatal("invalid multibyte character");
2056 ins[0] = '\\';
2057 memcpy(ins + 1, tmp2 + i, clen);
2058 ins[clen + 1] = '\0';
2059 switch (tmp2[i]) {
2060 case '\'':
2061 case '"':
2062 case '\\':
2063 case '\t':
2064 case '[':
2065 case ' ':
2066 case '#':
2067 case '*':
2068 if (quote == '\0' || tmp2[i] == quote) {
2069 if (el_insertstr(el, ins) == -1)
2070 fatal("el_insertstr "
2071 "failed.");
2072 break;
2073 }
2074 /* FALLTHROUGH */
2075 default:
2076 if (el_insertstr(el, ins + 1) == -1)
2077 fatal("el_insertstr failed.");
2078 break;
2079 }
2080 }
2081 }
2082
2083 lf = el_line(el);
2084 if (g.gl_matchc == 1) {
2085 i = 0;
2086 if (!terminated && quote != '\0')
2087 ins[i++] = quote;
2088 if (*(lf->cursor - 1) != '/' &&
2089 (lastarg || *(lf->cursor) != ' '))
2090 ins[i++] = ' ';
2091 ins[i] = '\0';
2092 if (i > 0 && el_insertstr(el, ins) == -1)
2093 fatal("el_insertstr failed.");
2094 }
2095 free(tmp);
2096
2097 out:
2098 globfree(&g);
2099 return g.gl_matchc;
2100}
2101
2102/* tab-completion hook function, called via libedit */
2103static unsigned char
2104complete(EditLine *el, int ch)
2105{
2106 char **argv, *line, quote;
2107 int argc, carg;
2108 u_int cursor, len, terminated, ret = CC_ERROR;
2109 const LineInfo *lf;
2110 struct complete_ctx *complete_ctx;
2111
2112 lf = el_line(el);
2113 if (el_get(el, EL_CLIENTDATA, &complete_ctx) != 0)
2114 fatal("%s: el_get failed", __func__);
2115
2116 /* Figure out which argument the cursor points to */
2117 cursor = lf->cursor - lf->buffer;
2118 line = xmalloc(cursor + 1);
2119 memcpy(line, lf->buffer, cursor);
2120 line[cursor] = '\0';
2121 argv = makeargv(line, &carg, 1, &quote, &terminated);
2122 free(line);
2123
2124 /* Get all the arguments on the line */
2125 len = lf->lastchar - lf->buffer;
2126 line = xmalloc(len + 1);
2127 memcpy(line, lf->buffer, len);
2128 line[len] = '\0';
2129 argv = makeargv(line, &argc, 1, NULL, NULL);
2130
2131 /* Ensure cursor is at EOL or a argument boundary */
2132 if (line[cursor] != ' ' && line[cursor] != '\0' &&
2133 line[cursor] != '\n') {
2134 free(line);
2135 return ret;
2136 }
2137
2138 if (carg == 0) {
2139 /* Show all available commands */
2140 complete_cmd_parse(el, NULL, argc == carg, '\0', 1);
2141 ret = CC_REDISPLAY;
2142 } else if (carg == 1 && cursor > 0 && line[cursor - 1] != ' ') {
2143 /* Handle the command parsing */
2144 if (complete_cmd_parse(el, argv[0], argc == carg,
2145 quote, terminated) != 0)
2146 ret = CC_REDISPLAY;
2147 } else if (carg >= 1) {
2148 /* Handle file parsing */
2149 int remote = complete_is_remote(argv[0]);
2150 char *filematch = NULL;
2151
2152 if (carg > 1 && line[cursor-1] != ' ')
2153 filematch = argv[carg - 1];
2154
2155 if (remote != 0 &&
2156 complete_match(el, complete_ctx->conn,
2157 *complete_ctx->remote_pathp, filematch,
2158 remote, carg == argc, quote, terminated) != 0)
2159 ret = CC_REDISPLAY;
2160 }
2161
2162 free(line);
2163 return ret;
2164}
2165
2166static int
2167interactive_loop(struct sftp_conn *conn, const char *file1, const char *file2)
2168{
2169 char *remote_path;
2170 char *dir = NULL, *startdir = NULL;
2171 char cmd[2048];
2172 int err, interactive;
2173 EditLine *el = NULL;
2174 History *hl = NULL;
2175 HistEvent hev;
2176 extern char *__progname;
2177 struct complete_ctx complete_ctx;
2178
2179 if (!batchmode && isatty(STDIN_FILENO)) {
2180 if ((el = el_init(__progname, stdin, stdout, stderr)) == NULL)
2181 fatal("Couldn't initialise editline");
2182 if ((hl = history_init()) == NULL)
2183 fatal("Couldn't initialise editline history");
2184 history(hl, &hev, H_SETSIZE, 100);
2185 el_set(el, EL_HIST, history, hl);
2186
2187 el_set(el, EL_PROMPT, prompt);
2188 el_set(el, EL_EDITOR, "emacs");
2189 el_set(el, EL_TERMINAL, NULL);
2190 el_set(el, EL_SIGNAL, 1);
2191 el_source(el, NULL);
2192
2193 /* Tab Completion */
2194 el_set(el, EL_ADDFN, "ftp-complete",
2195 "Context sensitive argument completion", complete);
2196 complete_ctx.conn = conn;
2197 complete_ctx.remote_pathp = &remote_path;
2198 el_set(el, EL_CLIENTDATA, (void*)&complete_ctx);
2199 el_set(el, EL_BIND, "^I", "ftp-complete", NULL);
2200 /* enable ctrl-left-arrow and ctrl-right-arrow */
2201 el_set(el, EL_BIND, "\\e[1;5C", "em-next-word", NULL);
2202 el_set(el, EL_BIND, "\\e[5C", "em-next-word", NULL);
2203 el_set(el, EL_BIND, "\\e[1;5D", "ed-prev-word", NULL);
2204 el_set(el, EL_BIND, "\\e\\e[D", "ed-prev-word", NULL);
2205 /* make ^w match ksh behaviour */
2206 el_set(el, EL_BIND, "^w", "ed-delete-prev-word", NULL);
2207 }
2208
2209 remote_path = do_realpath(conn, ".");
2210 if (remote_path == NULL)
2211 fatal("Need cwd");
2212 startdir = xstrdup(remote_path);
2213
2214 if (file1 != NULL) {
2215 dir = xstrdup(file1);
2216 dir = make_absolute(dir, remote_path);
2217
2218 if (remote_is_dir(conn, dir) && file2 == NULL) {
2219 if (!quiet)
2220 mprintf("Changing to: %s\n", dir);
2221 snprintf(cmd, sizeof cmd, "cd \"%s\"", dir);
2222 if (parse_dispatch_command(conn, cmd,
2223 &remote_path, startdir, 1, 0) != 0) {
2224 free(dir);
2225 free(startdir);
2226 free(remote_path);
2227 free(conn);
2228 return (-1);
2229 }
2230 } else {
2231 /* XXX this is wrong wrt quoting */
2232 snprintf(cmd, sizeof cmd, "get%s %s%s%s",
2233 global_aflag ? " -a" : "", dir,
2234 file2 == NULL ? "" : " ",
2235 file2 == NULL ? "" : file2);
2236 err = parse_dispatch_command(conn, cmd,
2237 &remote_path, startdir, 1, 0);
2238 free(dir);
2239 free(startdir);
2240 free(remote_path);
2241 free(conn);
2242 return (err);
2243 }
2244 free(dir);
2245 }
2246
2247 setvbuf(stdout, NULL, _IOLBF, 0);
2248 setvbuf(infile, NULL, _IOLBF, 0);
2249
2250 interactive = !batchmode && isatty(STDIN_FILENO);
2251 err = 0;
2252 for (;;) {
2253 const char *line;
2254 int count = 0;
2255
2256 signal(SIGINT, SIG_IGN);
2257
2258 if (el == NULL) {
2259 if (interactive)
2260 printf("sftp> ");
2261 if (fgets(cmd, sizeof(cmd), infile) == NULL) {
2262 if (interactive)
2263 printf("\n");
2264 break;
2265 }
2266 } else {
2267 if ((line = el_gets(el, &count)) == NULL ||
2268 count <= 0) {
2269 printf("\n");
2270 break;
2271 }
2272 history(hl, &hev, H_ENTER, line);
2273 if (strlcpy(cmd, line, sizeof(cmd)) >= sizeof(cmd)) {
2274 fprintf(stderr, "Error: input line too long\n");
2275 continue;
2276 }
2277 }
2278
2279 cmd[strcspn(cmd, "\n")] = '\0';
2280
2281 /* Handle user interrupts gracefully during commands */
2282 interrupted = 0;
2283 signal(SIGINT, cmd_interrupt);
2284
2285 err = parse_dispatch_command(conn, cmd, &remote_path,
2286 startdir, batchmode, !interactive && el == NULL);
2287 if (err != 0)
2288 break;
2289 }
2290 signal(SIGCHLD, SIG_DFL);
2291 free(remote_path);
2292 free(startdir);
2293 free(conn);
2294
2295 if (el != NULL)
2296 el_end(el);
2297
2298 /* err == 1 signifies normal "quit" exit */
2299 return (err >= 0 ? 0 : -1);
2300}
2301
2302static void
2303connect_to_server(const char *path, char **args, int *in, int *out)
2304{
2305 int c_in, c_out;
2306
2307 int inout[2];
2308
2309 if (socketpair(AF_UNIX, SOCK_STREAM, 0, inout) == -1)
2310 fatal("socketpair: %s", strerror(errno));
2311 *in = *out = inout[0];
2312 c_in = c_out = inout[1];
2313
2314 if ((sshpid = fork()) == -1)
2315 fatal("fork: %s", strerror(errno));
2316 else if (sshpid == 0) {
2317 if ((dup2(c_in, STDIN_FILENO) == -1) ||
2318 (dup2(c_out, STDOUT_FILENO) == -1)) {
2319 fprintf(stderr, "dup2: %s\n", strerror(errno));
2320 _exit(1);
2321 }
2322 close(*in);
2323 close(*out);
2324 close(c_in);
2325 close(c_out);
2326
2327 /*
2328 * The underlying ssh is in the same process group, so we must
2329 * ignore SIGINT if we want to gracefully abort commands,
2330 * otherwise the signal will make it to the ssh process and
2331 * kill it too. Contrawise, since sftp sends SIGTERMs to the
2332 * underlying ssh, it must *not* ignore that signal.
2333 */
2334 signal(SIGINT, SIG_IGN);
2335 signal(SIGTERM, SIG_DFL);
2336 execvp(path, args);
2337 fprintf(stderr, "exec: %s: %s\n", path, strerror(errno));
2338 _exit(1);
2339 }
2340
2341 signal(SIGTERM, killchild);
2342 signal(SIGINT, killchild);
2343 signal(SIGHUP, killchild);
2344 signal(SIGTSTP, suspchild);
2345 signal(SIGTTIN, suspchild);
2346 signal(SIGTTOU, suspchild);
2347 signal(SIGCHLD, sigchld_handler);
2348 close(c_in);
2349 close(c_out);
2350}
2351
2352__dead static void
2353usage(void)
2354{
2355 extern char *__progname;
2356
2357 fprintf(stderr,
2358 "usage: %s [-46aCfpqrv] [-B buffer_size] [-b batchfile] [-c cipher]\n"
2359 " [-D sftp_server_path] [-F ssh_config] [-i identity_file]\n"
2360 " [-J destination] [-l limit] [-o ssh_option] [-P port]\n"
2361 " [-R num_requests] [-S program] [-s subsystem | sftp_server]\n"
2362 " destination\n",
2363 __progname);
2364 exit(1);
2365}
2366
2367int
2368main(int argc, char **argv)
2369{
2370 int in, out, ch, err, tmp, port = -1;
2371 char *host = NULL, *user, *cp, *file2 = NULL;
2372 int debug_level = 0, sshver = 2;
2373 const char *file1 = NULL, *sftp_server = NULL;
2374 const char *ssh_program = _PATH_SSH_PROGRAM, *sftp_direct = NULL;
2375 const char *errstr;
2376 LogLevel ll = SYSLOG_LEVEL_INFO;
2377 arglist args;
2378 extern int optind;
2379 extern char *optarg;
2380 struct sftp_conn *conn;
2381 size_t copy_buffer_len = DEFAULT_COPY_BUFLEN;
2382 size_t num_requests = DEFAULT_NUM_REQUESTS;
2383 long long limit_kbps = 0;
2384
2385 ssh_malloc_init(); /* must be called before any mallocs */
2386 /* Ensure that fds 0, 1 and 2 are open or directed to /dev/null */
2387 sanitise_stdfd();
2388 setlocale(LC_CTYPE, "");
2389
2390 memset(&args, '\0', sizeof(args));
2391 args.list = NULL;
2392 addargs(&args, "%s", ssh_program);
2393 addargs(&args, "-oForwardX11 no");
2394 addargs(&args, "-oForwardAgent no");
2395 addargs(&args, "-oPermitLocalCommand no");
2396 addargs(&args, "-oClearAllForwardings yes");
2397
2398 ll = SYSLOG_LEVEL_INFO;
2399 infile = stdin;
2400
2401 while ((ch = getopt(argc, argv,
2402 "1246afhpqrvCc:D:i:l:o:s:S:b:B:F:J:P:R:")) != -1) {
2403 switch (ch) {
2404 /* Passed through to ssh(1) */
2405 case '4':
2406 case '6':
2407 case 'C':
2408 addargs(&args, "-%c", ch);
2409 break;
2410 /* Passed through to ssh(1) with argument */
2411 case 'F':
2412 case 'J':
2413 case 'c':
2414 case 'i':
2415 case 'o':
2416 addargs(&args, "-%c", ch);
2417 addargs(&args, "%s", optarg);
2418 break;
2419 case 'q':
2420 ll = SYSLOG_LEVEL_ERROR;
2421 quiet = 1;
2422 showprogress = 0;
2423 addargs(&args, "-%c", ch);
2424 break;
2425 case 'P':
2426 port = a2port(optarg);
2427 if (port <= 0)
2428 fatal("Bad port \"%s\"\n", optarg);
2429 break;
2430 case 'v':
2431 if (debug_level < 3) {
2432 addargs(&args, "-v");
2433 ll = SYSLOG_LEVEL_DEBUG1 + debug_level;
2434 }
2435 debug_level++;
2436 break;
2437 case '1':
2438 sshver = 1;
2439 if (sftp_server == NULL)
2440 sftp_server = _PATH_SFTP_SERVER;
2441 break;
2442 case '2':
2443 sshver = 2;
2444 break;
2445 case 'a':
2446 global_aflag = 1;
2447 break;
2448 case 'B':
2449 copy_buffer_len = strtol(optarg, &cp, 10);
2450 if (copy_buffer_len == 0 || *cp != '\0')
2451 fatal("Invalid buffer size \"%s\"", optarg);
2452 break;
2453 case 'b':
2454 if (batchmode)
2455 fatal("Batch file already specified.");
2456
2457 /* Allow "-" as stdin */
2458 if (strcmp(optarg, "-") != 0 &&
2459 (infile = fopen(optarg, "r")) == NULL)
2460 fatal("%s (%s).", strerror(errno), optarg);
2461 showprogress = 0;
2462 quiet = batchmode = 1;
2463 addargs(&args, "-obatchmode yes");
2464 break;
2465 case 'f':
2466 global_fflag = 1;
2467 break;
2468 case 'p':
2469 global_pflag = 1;
2470 break;
2471 case 'D':
2472 sftp_direct = optarg;
2473 break;
2474 case 'l':
2475 limit_kbps = strtonum(optarg, 1, 100 * 1024 * 1024,
2476 &errstr);
2477 if (errstr != NULL)
2478 usage();
2479 limit_kbps *= 1024; /* kbps */
2480 break;
2481 case 'r':
2482 global_rflag = 1;
2483 break;
2484 case 'R':
2485 num_requests = strtol(optarg, &cp, 10);
2486 if (num_requests == 0 || *cp != '\0')
2487 fatal("Invalid number of requests \"%s\"",
2488 optarg);
2489 break;
2490 case 's':
2491 sftp_server = optarg;
2492 break;
2493 case 'S':
2494 ssh_program = optarg;
2495 replacearg(&args, 0, "%s", ssh_program);
2496 break;
2497 case 'h':
2498 default:
2499 usage();
2500 }
2501 }
2502
2503 if (!isatty(STDERR_FILENO))
2504 showprogress = 0;
2505
2506 log_init(argv[0], ll, SYSLOG_FACILITY_USER, 1);
2507
2508 if (sftp_direct == NULL) {
2509 if (optind == argc || argc > (optind + 2))
2510 usage();
2511 argv += optind;
2512
2513 switch (parse_uri("sftp", *argv, &user, &host, &tmp, &file1)) {
2514 case -1:
2515 usage();
2516 break;
2517 case 0:
2518 if (tmp != -1)
2519 port = tmp;
2520 break;
2521 default:
2522 if (parse_user_host_path(*argv, &user, &host,
2523 &file1) == -1) {
2524 /* Treat as a plain hostname. */
2525 host = xstrdup(*argv);
2526 host = cleanhostname(host);
2527 }
2528 break;
2529 }
2530 file2 = *(argv + 1);
2531
2532 if (!*host) {
2533 fprintf(stderr, "Missing hostname\n");
2534 usage();
2535 }
2536
2537 if (port != -1)
2538 addargs(&args, "-oPort %d", port);
2539 if (user != NULL) {
2540 addargs(&args, "-l");
2541 addargs(&args, "%s", user);
2542 }
2543 addargs(&args, "-oProtocol %d", sshver);
2544
2545 /* no subsystem if the server-spec contains a '/' */
2546 if (sftp_server == NULL || strchr(sftp_server, '/') == NULL)
2547 addargs(&args, "-s");
2548
2549 addargs(&args, "--");
2550 addargs(&args, "%s", host);
2551 addargs(&args, "%s", (sftp_server != NULL ?
2552 sftp_server : "sftp"));
2553
2554 connect_to_server(ssh_program, args.list, &in, &out);
2555 } else {
2556 args.list = NULL;
2557 addargs(&args, "sftp-server");
2558
2559 connect_to_server(sftp_direct, args.list, &in, &out);
2560 }
2561 freeargs(&args);
2562
2563 conn = do_init(in, out, copy_buffer_len, num_requests, limit_kbps);
2564 if (conn == NULL)
2565 fatal("Couldn't initialise connection to server");
2566
2567 if (!quiet) {
2568 if (sftp_direct == NULL)
2569 fprintf(stderr, "Connected to %s.\n", host);
2570 else
2571 fprintf(stderr, "Attached to %s.\n", sftp_direct);
2572 }
2573
2574 err = interactive_loop(conn, file1, file2);
2575
2576 close(in);
2577 close(out);
2578 if (batchmode)
2579 fclose(infile);
2580
2581 while (waitpid(sshpid, NULL, 0) == -1 && sshpid > 1)
2582 if (errno != EINTR)
2583 fatal("Couldn't wait for ssh process: %s",
2584 strerror(errno));
2585
2586 exit(err == 0 ? 0 : 1);
2587}
